summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, setting the trial start date for November 29, 2021, with jury selection the week of November 15, 2021. The order grants the government's motion to exclude time under the Speedy Trial Act and establishes a schedule for motions and pretrial disclosures.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20-CR-330) for which this order is issued, setting her trial schedule.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order, setting the trial schedule and granting the government's motion to exclude time under the Speedy Trial Act.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell, as evidenced by this order setting the trial schedule.

events.title: Trial Start Date Set
events.description: The court orders that opening statements for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell will commence on this date, pending approval from the Clerk's Office.

events.title: Jury Selection Week
events.description: The court requests that jury selection for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial occur during this week.

events.title: Deadline for Joint Letter
events.description: The parties are ordered to meet, confer, and submit a joint letter by this date regarding the overall pretrial disclosure schedule.

keyFacts: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell was officially scheduled to begin with opening statements on November 29, 2021.
Jury selection was scheduled for the week of November 15, 2021.
Judge Alison J. Nathan granted the government's motion to exclude time under the Speedy Trial Act until November 29, 2021, citing the need for defense review of discovery and pretrial preparation.
The order establishes a deadline for motions in limine to be fully briefed four weeks before the trial date and requires the parties to submit a joint letter on the pretrial schedule by May 14, 2021.
